article:
A 12-year-old boy saw something in a shop window that set his heart racing. But the   _  -
five dollars - was far beyond Reuben Earle's money. Five dollars would  _  almost a week's food for his family.
But hearing the sound of hammering   from a side street, Reuben had a(n)   _  . He ran towards the sound and discovered
he could  _  the hessian sacks   which were thrown away and sell them for five cents a piece.
Every day   after school  , Reuben walked down the town, collecting  the sacks  . On
the day the school closed for the summer, no student was more  _  than Reuben, for he had more time for his "work". Then one day the
time had  _  .
Reuben ran down Water Street to the   _  . "Please, Mister. I have to sell the sacks
now." The man took the sacks,  _  into his pocket
and placed four coins in Reuben's hand. Reuben said a thank you and  _  home. On arriving home, Reuben uncovered the tin can  _  he kept the money. He poured the coins out and began to count. He had  _  .
Then he headed for the shop. "I have the money," he told the owner   _  . The man went
to the window and  took out  Reuben's treasure. He wiped
the dust off, carefully wrapped   it in brown paper and   _  it to
Reuben.
Racing home, Reuben shouted, "Here, Mom! Here!" He placed a small   _  in her
hands. She unwrapped it carefully. A jewel box  _  .
Dora lifted the lid  , tears beginning to fill her eyes. Dora had   _  received
such a gift; she had no jewelry  except for  her wedding
ring. Speechless, she smiled and gathered her son into her arms.
